title: Acute reversible rhabdomyolysis during direct-acting antiviral hepatitis C virus treatment: a case report
patient: We report a 31-year-old Saudi male patient who presented initially to the neurology clinic at King Faisal Specialist Hospital and Research Centre, Jeddah, to evaluate reversible recurrent rhabdomyolysis. The patient was healthy and had no medical background prior to this presentation. He denied the use of any medications or herbal agents. His family history was negative for any neurological illnesses, and his parents were not related. The patient was unemployed at the time of the first presentation. He habitually smoked one pack of cigarettes per day for 10 years, however, he had no history of alcohol intake or illicit drug use.
